recipes.title: Vegan Buddha Bowl
instructions: Rinse the quinoa under cold water, then cook in a saucepan with 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes until fluffy.
Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium heat, add a drizzle of olive oil, and warm the chickpeas with a pinch of salt and pepper until slightly crispy around the edges.
Slice the avocado and halve the cherry tomatoes. Wash and dry the spinach leaves thoroughly.
In a large bowl, layer the cooked quinoa, seasoned chickpeas, avocado slices, cherry tomatoes, and spinach in neat sections to create a colorful bowl.
Drizzle the tahini sauce evenly over all components, then gently toss before serving for an even flavor distribution, or leave artfully arranged for presentation.

recipes.title: Chocolate Lava Cake
instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Generously butter two 6-ounce ramekins and dust with cocoa powder to prevent sticking.
In a heatproof bowl set over simmering water (double boiler), melt the dark chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth.
Remove from heat, whisk in the powdered sugar until fully incorporated, then add in the eggs and egg yolks, one at a time.
Gently fold in the flour just until the batter is uniform without overmixing. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared ramekins.
Bake on the center rack for 12–14 minutes. The edges should be firm while the centers remain gooey. Let cakes rest for 1 minute before inverting onto plates.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add spaghetti and cook until just al dente, about 8–10 minutes.
While pasta cooks, heat a skillet over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant. Add diced pancetta and cook until crisp and golden.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan, and a generous crack of black pepper until creamy.
Reserve 1/4 cup of pasta water, drain spaghetti, and immediately add to the skillet with pancetta. Remove from heat.
Quickly pour egg mixture over the pasta, tossing constantly to create a silky sauce. If needed, add reserved pasta water to reach desired creaminess.

recipes.title: Masala Dosa
instructions: Heat a teaspoon of oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves; cook until they start to crackle.
Add sliced onions and chopped green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent and fragrant.
Stir in the mashed potatoes, season with salt, and cook for 2–3 minutes, mashing any large chunks and blending flavors.
Heat a non-stick griddle over high heat. Pour a ladle of dosa batter and spread it in a thin circle until the edges lift slightly.
Place a portion of the potato filling in the center, fold the dosa over to encase the filling, and cook for another minute before serving hot.

recipes.title: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast the bread slices until golden brown and crispy. This adds texture and prevents sogginess.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Mash with a fork until creamy but still slightly chunky.
Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper to the avocado mash. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Spread the seasoned avocado evenly onto the warm toast. Sprinkle chili flakes on top for a subtle kick.
Serve immediately as a nutritious snack or light breakfast with a squeeze of extra lemon if desired.

recipes.title: Tiramisu
instructions: In a heatproof bowl set over simmering water, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale, thick, and ribbon-like (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat.
Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then gently fold in the mascarpone cheese until smooth and lump-free.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the cooled espresso—do not soak—to prevent sogginess, and layer them in a shallow dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone cream over the soaked ladyfingers, then repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and the remaining cream.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours (or overnight) to let flavors meld. Dust generously with cocoa powder before serving.

recipes.title: Chickpea Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, sauté until golden brown.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 30 seconds to bloom the spices. Pour in the tomato puree and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas, stir to coat in the sauce, then pour in the coconut milk. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Cook for 10–15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the curry thickens and flavors deepen. Season with salt.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot alongside steamed rice or flatbread.

recipes.title: Buttermilk Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda until evenly combined.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg lightly, then whisk in the buttermilk and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir gently until just combined—lumps are okay.
Heat a non-stick griddle or skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another 1–2 minutes until golden brown.
